story:
Once upon a time, in a small village nestled between the mountains, there lived a kind and wise Buddhist monk named Tamo. Tamo was known throughout the land for his peaceful demeanor and his ability to teach even the most difficult concepts in a way that was easy to understand.

One day, a young girl named Yara came to visit Tamo. She was troubled, for she had lost her favorite doll and could not find it anywhere. Tamo listened carefully to Yara's story and then asked her, "When was the last time you remember having your doll with you?"

Yara thought for a moment and then replied, "I had it with me when I was walking through the forest this morning."

Tamo smiled gently and said, "Then, let us go to the forest and see if we can find your doll."

So, Yara and Tamo set out on their journey. As they walked, Tamo asked Yara to close her eyes and focus on her breathing. He taught her how to calm her mind and open her heart.

After a while, Tamo asked Yara to open her eyes and look around her. Yara was amazed to see the forest in a whole new light. She noticed the sway of the trees, the rustle of the leaves, and the gentle sound of the river flowing. She felt a sense of peace wash over her.

Suddenly, Yara spotted her doll, nestled among the tall grass. She ran over and picked it up, hugging it tightly. She looked up at Tamo and asked, "How did you know we would find my doll in the forest?"

Tamo chuckled and replied, "I did not know for certain, but I had faith that the universe would guide us in the right direction. When we trust in the present moment, and when we let go of our worries, we can find peace and happiness in any situation."

Yara smiled, happy to be reunited with her doll and grateful for Tamo's wisdom. She thanked him and they walked back to the village, hand in hand, both of them feeling a sense of peace and contentment in their hearts.

From that day on, Yara made a point to practice calmness and mindfulness whenever she felt troubled. And she lived a happy and fulfilling life, always remembering Tamo's wise words.

The end.

May this story bring peace and happiness to your heart and your home. Goodnight, my dear.
